alert.note: Alert for Cass; Lancaster; Sarpy; Saunders (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 5:53AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sarpy, northeastern Lancaster, southeastern Saunders and northwestern Cass Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 553 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles southeast of Davey, or 10 miles north of Lincoln, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Waverly around 600 AM CDT. Greenwood around 610 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Ashland and Murdock. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska near mile marker 407, and between mile markers 411 and 428. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
